title: U.S., Canada Use Different Approaches To Defend Against Terrorism
teaser: Robert Siegel speaks with Karen Greenberg, director of the Center on National Security at Fordham Law School. She describes the different ways that Canada, Australia and the United Kingdom have responded to acts of random terrorist violence, both real and alleged.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
